datascilib.Regression.LinearRegression.regression

Class MultiLinearRegression

  • java.lang.Object
    • datascilib.Regression.LinearRegression.regression.MultiLinearRegression

  • public class MultiLinearRegression
extends java.lang.Object

    MultiLinearRegression

    Multi-Linear Regression is a functional extension of Linear Regression, where each dependent variable is predicted using multiple independent variables. E.g. for every observation, there are multiple factors in play to create the observed phenomenon. The inputs should be a 1-dimensional Double array y and a numObservations by numFactors Double array x. As of 2020-04-26, it is implemented assuming non-correlative relationships between factors.

    Use any of the 'fit' functions to calculate coefficients. As of 2020-04-26 only simple fit is implemented which summates results from numFactors 1-dimensional LineaarRegression calculations in order to calculate coefficients coeffs and uses a weighted average of 1-dimensional LinearRegression outputs to calculate the intercept.

    Some global values may be unused as other methods of multivariate linear regression are being added.
    Since:
    2020-04-26

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.Double[] coeffs
      A Double representing the calculated slope coefficients for the input dataset.

      The number of data points to allocate each thread.

      A Double representing the calculated intercept for the input dataset.

      private int numFactors
      The int value representing the number of factors per observation in input x.

      The int value representing the number of observations in the overall dataset, equals y's length and x's number of rows.

      The System.out.println wrapper class which is used for multileveled printing.

      The number of data points to allocate to the last thread in addition to dataPerThread.

      The number of threads to use in multi-threaded implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • simpleFit

        public void simpleFit()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                      java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Calculates coeffs, intercepts, and intercept using multiple instances of LinearRegression to calculate each coefficient. The calculated standard errors are used as weightings to calculate intercept. No arg simpleFit() sequentially calls the parallel version of LinearRegression's simpleFit.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getEstimatedValue

        public java.lang.Double getEstimatedValue(java.lang.Double[] xValues)
        Calculates the estimated (predicted) value given a Double array of factors.
        Parameters:
        xValues - is the input array of factors, must be the same length as the length of factors MultiLinearRegression was constructed with.
        Returns:
        the estimated (predicted) value = sum ( coeff_i * xValue_i ) + intercept, where i ranges from 0 - the number of factors numFactors.

      • calcualteStandardError

        public java.lang.Double calcualteStandardError()
        Calculated the standard (average) error between the predicted and observed data. Since the standard error calculation comprises simple 2-step sub-calculations parallelerization time would be equivalent to sequential time. Therefore this method is fully sequential.
        Returns:
        the standard error of the prediction.
